str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From ana and zonnumi; to gird afresh.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From dia and nous; deep thought, properly, the faculty, by implication, its exercise.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (lit: I am sober), I am calm (vigilant), circumspect. Of uncertain affinity: to abstain from wine, i.e. be discreet.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.
Perfectly, completely, without wavering. Adverb from teleios; completely, i.e. without wavering.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
An unveiling, uncovering, revealing, revelation. From apokalupto; disclosure.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
